page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: THE D_BLOCK IS MAINLY HIGH GROUND LIGHTLY WOODED.THE MAIN TOWN IS GREAT HARWOOD.AGRICULTURAL LAND CARRIES COWS AND SHEEP.HAY AND SILAGE SUPPLY WINTER FEED.PROSPERITY WAS BASED ON THE COTTON TRADE ALL MILLS EXCEPT ONE NOW CLOSED.RAILWAY CLOSED 1957.THE TOWN HAS A VARIETY OF LIGHT INDUSTRIES,A WEEKLY MARKET,A VARIETY OF SHOPS THERE IS A COUNCIL ESTATE BUT MOST HOUSING IS TERRACED WITH RESIDENTIAL HOUSING ON THE FRINGES.THE TOWN HAS A CHARTER FAIR AND AN ANNUAL AGRICULTURAL SHOW.THERE IS A FOOTBALL CLUB,A CRICKET CLUB,A GOLF CLUB AND PARKS WITH SEVERAL OTHER RECREATIONAL AMENITIES.THE AREA HAS AN INTERESTING HISTORY TRACEABLE TO VIKING TIMES.MANY PROMINENT BUILDINGS HAVE SURVIVED TO REMIND US OF THE TOWNS HISTORY.
